resources.string: In line with the UK government\'s COVID-19 guidelines, when visiting these small eateries for takeaway, please put on your mask and ensure that you are socially distanced from people. Avoid touching your face or any unnecessary surfaces. Do not travel outside of your local area for takeaway services and keep your numbers to a minimum while ordering takeaway. Upon arriving back home, wash your hands thoroughly with soap and ensure surfaces are wiped clean after consuming the food.

StrEats first sprang to life on a cold Saturday evening in Central London during the 3rd UK lockdown. Streets were empty, retail shops were shut and small fool businesses all across Central London were slowly closing down one by one. 4 university students studying Computer Science visited a small eatery for takeaway and were deeply taken aback by the struggles of the small eatery that we had visited. The obstacles and challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic suddenly became all too real. \n\n Wanting to use our knowledge to help these small eateries through the pandemic and lockdown, we came up with StrEats! StrEats, a combination of the words "Street" and "Eats", is a mobile application that allows you to easily locate small food eateries in the city. Our hope is to raise awareness about the current situation of small businesses and encourage more people to order from theseâ€¦
All the restaurants that we love and recommend that you eat at!
